alert.note: Alert for Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 23 at 7:37AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact northern Mitchell and Mower Counties through 830 AM CDT... At 737 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Blooming Prairie to near Northwood. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Austin around 740 AM CDT. Lyle around 745 AM CDT. Brownsdale around 750 AM CDT. Rose Creek around 755 AM CDT. Stacyville around 805 AM CDT. Adams around 810 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Meyer, Toeterville, Otranto, Brookside Campground, Mayville, County Roads 4 And 8, Waltham, Renova, Mona, and County Roads 1 And 15. This includes Interstate 90 in Minnesota between mile markers 175 and 204. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
